data.title: Criminal Psychology Research
data.text: Exploring the causes, characteristics, and intervention strategies of criminal psychology to aid crime prevention and rehabilitation.

data.title: Overview of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter introduces the definition, history, basic theories, and research areas of criminal psychology.

items.title: Definition of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology is the study of criminal behavior and its psychological mechanisms, aiming to understand the psychological characteristics and behavioral motivations of offenders.

items.title: Development History of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology originated in the late 19th century and gradually became an independent discipline with the development of psychology and law.

items.title: Main Research Areas
items.text: Including causes of criminal psychology, crime type analysis, criminal psychology assessment and intervention, etc.

items.title: Relationship with Other Disciplines
items.text: Criminal psychology is closely related to law, sociology, biology, and other disciplines, jointly exploring criminal phenomena.

items.title: Biological Theory
items.text: Exploring the influence of genetic, neurophysiological, and other factors on criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Theory
items.text: Analyzing the relationship between psychological factors such as personality, cognition, and emotion with criminal behavior.

items.title: Sociological Theory
items.text: Studying the shaping effect of social environment and cultural background on criminal psychology.

items.title: Integrated Theory
items.text: Combining biological, psychological, and sociological perspectives to comprehensively explain criminal psychology.

data.title: Formation of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter explores the influence of individual factors, environmental factors, and psychological processes on criminal psychology.

items.title: Genetic Factors
items.text: Studying the potential link between genes and criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Traits
items.text: Exploring the relationship between personality traits such as aggression and impulsivity with crime.

items.title: Personality Disorders
items.text: Analyzing the driving role of psychological disorders such as antisocial personality disorder in criminal behavior.

items.title: Early Experiences
items.text: Studying the long-term impact of childhood trauma, domestic violence, etc. on criminal psychology.

items.title: Family Environment
items.text: Exploring the shaping effect of family structure and parenting methods on criminal psychology.

items.title: Social Environment Influence
items.text: Analyzing the inducing effect of peer pressure and community environment on criminal behavior.

items.title: Economic Factors
items.text: Studying the relationship between economic issues such as poverty and unemployment with crime rates.

items.title: Cultural Background
items.text: Exploring the influence of cultural values on criminal psychology.

items.title: Cognitive Processes
items.text: Analyzing the thinking patterns and decision-making models of offenders and their impact on behavior.

items.title: Emotional Processes
items.text: Exploring the relationship between emotional regulation, emotional deficits, and criminal behavior.

items.title: Behavioral Motivation
items.text: Studying the internal motivations of offenders, such as profit-driven and revenge psychology.

items.title: Decision-Making Mechanisms
items.text: Analyzing the decision-making process and psychological mechanisms of offenders before committing crimes.

data.title: Crime Types and Psychological Characteristics
data.text: This chapter analyzes the psychological characteristics of violent crimes, property crimes, and cybercrimes.

items.title: Murder Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring the psychological motivations of murderers, such as emotional conflicts and competition for interests.

items.title: Robbery Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the risk-taking psychology of robbers and their dependence on violence.

items.title: Sexual Crime Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Studying the psychological distortions and behavioral patterns of sexual offenders.

items.title: Domestic Violence Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring the control desires and emotional deficits of domestic violence perpetrators.

items.title: Theft Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the lucky mentality of thieves and their desire for material possessions.

items.title: Fraud Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring the deception skills and psychological manipulation abilities of fraudsters.

items.title: Embezzlement Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Studying the power desires and moral degradation of embezzlers.

items.title: Money Laundering Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the risk-avoidance psychology and legal evasion strategies of money launderers.

items.title: Hacker Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring hackers' technology worship and psychology of challenging authority.

items.title: Online Fraud Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the disguise abilities and psychological manipulation techniques of online fraudsters.

items.title: Cyberbullying Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Studying the anonymity psychology and aggression of cyberbullying perpetrators.

items.title: Internet Addiction and Crime
items.text: Exploring the dependence of internet addicts on the virtual world and its association with criminal behavior.

data.title: Criminal Psychology Assessment and Intervention
data.text: This chapter introduces criminal psychology assessment methods and intervention strategies, exploring preventive measures.

items.title: Psychological Testing
items.text: Assessing the psychological state and personality characteristics of offenders through standardized tests.

items.title: Behavioral Observation
items.text: Observing the daily behavior of offenders to analyze their behavioral patterns and psychological motivations.

items.title: Interview Techniques
items.text: Understanding the psychological journey and criminal motivations of offenders through in-depth interviews.

items.title: Case Analysis
items.text: Analyzing the psychological characteristics and behavioral patterns of offenders through typical cases.

items.title: Psychological Therapy
items.text: Helping offenders correct psychological problems through counseling and treatment.

items.title: Behavioral Correction
items.text: Helping offenders change negative behavioral patterns through behavioral training.

items.title: Social Support
items.text: Providing social resource support to help offenders reintegrate into society.

items.title: Legal Intervention
items.text: Constraining and punishing criminal behavior through legal means.

items.title: Early Intervention
items.text: Preventing behavioral problems of potential offenders through early psychological intervention.

items.title: Educational Prevention
items.text: Improving public legal awareness and mental health levels through education.

items.title: Community Prevention
items.text: Enhancing social cohesion through community activities to reduce crime triggers.

items.title: Policy Prevention
items.text: Reducing social inequality through policy-making to lower crime rates.

data.title: Applications of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter explores the applications of criminal psychology in criminal justice, crime prevention, and research education.

items.title: Criminal Profiling
items.text: Describing offender characteristics through psychological analysis to assist case investigation.

items.title: Interrogation Techniques
items.text: Using psychological methods to improve interrogation efficiency and obtain truthful confessions.

items.title: Witness Psychology
items.text: Studying the psychological state of witnesses and its impact on testimony credibility.

items.title: Jury Decision-Making
items.text: Analyzing the psychological processes of jurors and their impact on verdict outcomes.

items.title: Crime Prevention Strategies
items.text: Preventing criminal behavior through psychological intervention and social support.

items.title: Prison Psychological Rehabilitation
items.text: Helping inmates correct psychological problems through psychological treatment to reduce recidivism.

items.title: Community Corrections
items.text: Helping offenders reintegrate into society through community support to reduce recidivism risk.

items.title: Recidivism Prevention
items.text: Reducing the likelihood of offender recidivism through psychological assessment and intervention.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Research
items.text: Deepening understanding of criminal psychology through scientific research to advance the discipline.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Education
items.text: Cultivating professionals through education to improve the application level of criminal psychology.

items.title: Professional Training
items.text: Improving the psychological knowledge and skills of judicial personnel through training.

items.title: Academic Exchange
items.text: Promoting international cooperation and development in the field of criminal psychology through academic exchange.

data.title: Future Development Trends
data.text: This chapter explores the future development directions of criminal psychology in technology applications, interdisciplinary collaboration, and ethical challenges.

items.title: Artificial Intelligence and Criminal Psychology
items.text: Using artificial intelligence technology to analyze criminal data and improve crime prediction capabilities.

items.title: Big Data Analysis
items.text: Mining patterns and psychological characteristics of criminal behavior through big data technology.

items.title: Virtual Reality Technology
items.text: Using virtual reality technology to simulate crime scenes and study offenders' psychological reactions.

items.title: Neuroscience Research
items.text: Exploring the biological basis of criminal behavior through neuroscience research.

items.title: Psychology and Law
items.text: Strengthening cooperation between psychology and law to improve the scientific nature of the judicial system.

items.title: Psychology and Medicine
items.text: Deepening understanding of criminal psychology through the combination of psychology and medicine.

items.title: Psychology and Sociology
items.text: Comprehensively analyzing criminal phenomena through cross-research between psychology and sociology.

items.title: Psychology and Information Technology
items.text: Combining psychology and information technology to develop new tools for crime prevention and intervention.

items.title: Ethical Issues
items.text: Exploring ethical dilemmas and solutions in criminal psychology research.

items.title: Privacy Protection
items.text: Studying how to protect personal privacy in criminal psychology applications.

items.title: Data Security
items.text: Analyzing security risks and protective measures for criminal psychology data.

items.title: Future Challenges
items.text: Exploring the technological and social challenges that criminal psychology may face in future development.
